sentences.sCn: “你必须做到专门化。” 他说。

sentences.sContent: Rules govern how to specialize safely: Each new information type must map to an existing one, and new information types must be more restrictive than the existing one in the content that they allow.
sentences.sContent_eng: Rules govern how to specialize safely: Each new information type must map to an existing one, and new information types must be more restrictive than the existing one in the content that they allow.
sentences.sCn: 规则可以监管如何安全地专门化：每一新信息类型必须映射到现有的一种类型，而且新信息类型必须比它们所允许的内容中现成的更加有限制性。

sentences.sContent: Or it may be made up solely of analysts who specialize in requirements gathering and use case development.
sentences.sContent_eng: Or it may be made up solely of analysts who specialize in requirements gathering and use case development.
sentences.sCn: 或者，这个团队可以仅由那些专门进行需求收集和用例开发的分析人员组成。

synos.tran: 专门从事；详细说明；特化
使专门化；使适应特殊情况；详细说明

words.tran: 专家的；专攻的；专门学科的
特使，特派人员；特刊；特色菜；专车；特价商品
专业，专长；特产；特性；招牌菜
专门化；特殊化；特化作用
专业化（等于specialization）；特化，适应化
专攻（specialize的过去分词）；使…专门化；详细说明
使专门化；专攻；详细说明（specialise的过去分词）
使专门化；限定…的范围；深入（等于specialize）

trans.tranOther: to limit all or most of your study, business etc to a particular subject or activity
